critique: This document pertains to the certification and appointment of Native American teachers in Indian schools. It outlines exceptions to standard examination requirements for graduates of specific normal schools. The document appears to be focused on facilitating the employment of Native American teachers within the Bureau of Indian Affairs system. There is no clear indication of a left-right ideological leaning. The document does not directly address immigration. It does not seem to expand executive power. The document does not obviously shift power between state and federal entities. The document does not directly address national security or civil liberties. The document does not directly address economic regulation. The document seems to promote the inclusion of Native Americans as teachers, but within a system of schools for Native Americans, which could also be seen as segregationist.
